Requirement Text: The system shall maintain thermal conditions within ±1°C of the specified temperature range for optimal ZBLAN fiber production.
The system shall operate with an energy efficiency of at least 80%, minimizing power consumption during manufacturing processes.
The system shall maintain consistent product quality across production runs, with less than 5% variation in key quality metrics between batches.
The system shall be capable of automatically restarting fiber production within 10 minutes of a production break, maintaining at least 90% of pre-break production quality.
The system shall produce materials at costs competitive with terrestrial alternatives, accounting for performance benefits of space-manufactured products with a target of $800$ per meter of fiber

The system shall support the generation of revenue from at least three distinct sources: product sales, technology licensing, and contracted research services, as verified by a business case analysis.
The system shall achieve a manufacturing yield of at least 95% usable fiber.
The system shall maintain a production rate of at least 500 meters of ZBLAN fiber per day.
The system shall produce ZBLAN fibers with attenuation rates of 0.05 dB/km or lower at 2.5 ?m wavelength.
The system shall detect and respond to microgravity disturbances within 1 second to maintain manufacturing process stability.
The system shall incorporate automated fiber spooling mechanisms capable of handling continuous fiber lengths of up to 50 km.
The system shall maintain a microgravity environment with less than 10^-6 g during ZBLAN fiber production.
The system shall maintain thermal conditions within specified limits to ensure optimal operation of all components.

The system shall include fault-tolerant mechanisms capable of maintaining at least 90% of nominal operational functionality for up to 72 hours following a single-point component failure, as verified through fault injection testing and performance analysis.
The system shall include safety protocols to protect crew members during maintenance and operation in space.

The system shall incorporate supply chain management protocols capable of tracking and verifying the delivery of 95% of raw materials and components within ±5 days of scheduled delivery dates during nominal operations, as verified through system performance simulations and operational data analysis.
The system shall integrate seamlessly with launch operations, ensuring compatibility with standard launch vehicle interfaces and procedures.
The system shall provide sufficient radiation shielding to protect sensitive equipment and materials, ensuring less than 5% degradation in performance over its operational lifetime.
The system shall be adaptable to process at least three different types of products beyond ZBLAN within its operational lifetime
The system shall operate autonomously for at least 95% of its production time, including the ability to automatically restart fiber production after breaks.
The system shall be capable of scaling production capacity from initial demonstration levels to full commercial production levels of up to 50 km of ZBLAN fiber per draw.

The system shall include docking interfaces compliant with the International Docking System Standard (IDSS) to support the addition of at least two production modules post-launch, verified through interface conformity analysis and simulated docking operations.

The system shall include modular hardware and software interfaces that support integration of at least three new manufacturing technologies or processes, as verified by simulated upgrades and functional tests during design validation.

The system shall be compatible with NASA's Space Network (SN) ground control equipment, including the Tracking and Data Relay Satellite System (TDRSS), achieving at least 99.5% data transmission success during simulated and operational communication tests under nominal and contingency scenarios.
The system shall utilize standardized data formats and protocols for all manufacturing processes, system operations, and ground communications.

The system shall support secure and efficient distribution of manufacturing data, telemetry, and product information between the orbital platform and ground stations, with data transmission reliability of at least 99.9% and a latency of no more than 500 milliseconds, as verified by communication link performance tests.
The system shall withstand the harsh space environment, including radiation, thermal cycling, and micrometeoroid impacts, without critical failure.
The system shall maintain a minimum of 95% operational availability throughout its design life.

The system shall provide secure and reliable command and control capabilities for all orbital manufacturing operations, with at least 99.9% command success rate and data integrity, as verified by operational and simulated mission scenarios.
The system shall return manufactured ZBLAN fibers to Earth safely and intact for commercial use.
The system shall be designed to operate continuously in the space environment for a minimum of 5 years without requiring physical human intervention.
The system shall produce ZBLAN fibers with less than 1 crystallization defect per kilometer of fiber manufactured in microgravity
The system shall interface with a secure product return capsule capable of safely transporting at least 50 km of produced ZBLAN fiber to Earth.
The system shall interface with standardized raw material containers to facilitate easy resupply and material changeout.
The system shall provide interfaces for maintenance activities, allowing for easy access to critical components.
The system shall interface with external data systems to allow for the exchange of operational data and analytics.
The system shall provide intuitive interfaces that allow trained personnel to perform necessary operations with less than 1 hour of specific task training.
The system shall interface with existing space infrastructure for power, data, and other resources.

The system shall be compatible with the SpaceX Falcon 9 and United Launch Alliance Atlas V launch vehicles, as verified through review of the corresponding Interface Control Documents (ICDs) for each vehicle.
The system shall accommodate resupply of raw materials and retrieval of finished products via standard cargo spacecraft.
The system shall interface with the host space station or platform for power, thermal management, and structural support during test flights or as needed for repair and operational support on orbit
The system shall transmit manufacturing telemetry and product quality data to Earth in real-time.
The system shall receive commands and software updates from ground control stations.
The system shall transmit quality control data to Earth in real-time with a latency of no more than 1 second.
The system shall incorporate redundant quality control sensors with automatic failover capabilities to ensure continuous monitoring in case of sensor failure.
The system shall incorporate in-situ annealing capabilities to reduce internal stresses in the produced ZBLAN fibers.
The system shall control the diameter of the produced ZBLAN fiber within ±1% of the target diameter throughout the drawing process.
The system shall maintain precise alignment of the ZBLAN preform during the fiber drawing process, with a tolerance of ±0.1 mm.

The system shall provide remote monitoring capabilities with a data refresh rate of no more than 1 second, allowing ground-based operators to oversee system operations in real-time, with at least 99% uptime
The system shall perform automated inspections of manufactured products to ensure compliance with quality standards.
The system shall implement process optimization algorithms that improve manufacturing efficiency by at least 15% and reduce product defects to less than 2% of total production
The system shall have automated emergency shutdown and safing procedures that can be initiated within 60 seconds of detecting a critical anomaly.

The system shall implement encryption and secure data transmission protocols for all data exchanges between the orbital platform and ground stations, meeting or exceeding current industry standards for data security.
The system shall be designed to allow for component replacement or servicing in orbit, with at least 80% of critical components being replaceable without requiring a return to Earth.
The system shall incorporate waste management capabilities, including the ability to recycle at least 50% of waste materials generated during the manufacturing process.
The system shall ensure timely execution of manufacturing processes and respond promptly to operational commands and events.

The system shall implement risk management strategies that reduce identified operational hazards by at least 90%, ensuring mission success, as verified through a risk assessment showing a reduction in risk exposure by 90% or more and achieving a residual risk level of less than 5% of the total risk exposure.
The system shall enable scientific experiments in microgravity alongside manufacturing operations.
The system shall package and store completed ZBLAN fibers for return to Earth.

The system shall monitor and adjust manufacturing parameters in real-time with a response time of less than 500 ms to maintain product quality, as verified through operational testing and quality control data.
The system shall draw ZBLAN fibers from the heated preform at a consistent rate.
The system shall support secondary missions without compromising primary ZBLAN fiber production objectives.
All components of the system shall be at Technology Readiness Level (TRL) 6 or higher before integration into the final system.
The system shall demonstrate a positive return on investment within 5 years of full operational capability.
The system shall have a defined end-of-life plan that includes safe deorbiting or repurposing of at least 90% of its components.
The system shall adhere to international space treaties and regulations governing manufacturing in orbit.
The system shall not interfere with other payloads or operations on the host platform, if the system is being hosted.

The system shall comply with ISO 24113:2019 Space Debris Mitigation Requirements by preventing the generation of debris larger than 1 mm during its operational lifetime and ensuring end-of-life disposal via controlled re-entry within 25 years or transfer to a disposal orbit with a minimum perigee altitude of 2,000 km, as verified through orbital decay analysis.
The system shall use only materials and processes approved for use in the space environment.

The system shall demonstrate compatibility with at least 90% of technical standards and objectives outlined in the latest published guidance from relevant government agencies (e.g., NASA's Exploration Goals), verified through compliance assessments and interface certifications.
The system shall operate within the power budget allocated by the host space platform if it is being hosted
The system shall adhere to international space debris mitigation guidelines.
The system shall comply with all relevant NASA safety standards for operation on crewed space platforms.
The system shall provide appropriate response times for user interactions.
The system shall be user-friendly and provide a good experience.
The system shall store data using PostgreSQL database with Redis caching.
The system shall authenticate users and log all activities and send notifications and generate reports.
The interface display the current status to operators.
User credentials are validated by the authentication module when login attempts are made.
Fast startup.

The system shall provide a comprehensive user interface that allows operators to monitor all subsystem statuses including but not limited to power management, thermal control, communication links, navigation systems, and payload operations while also enabling configuration of system parameters, viewing of historical data trends, managing user accounts and permissions, generating custom reports, and performing diagnostic procedures.
The system shall efficiently process data as needed and provide sufficient bandwidth where applicable.
Shall respond within reasonable timeframe.
Navigation shall be implemented using GPS with appropriate accuracy for the mission.
The communication system shall utilize Iridium satellite constellation for global coverage.
The sensor shall have good accuracy and reasonable precision.
The motor shall operate faster than the previous version.
Data is processed by the central unit and results are transmitted to ground stations and alerts are generated when anomalies are detected.
Temperature control shall be achieved through the use of thermoelectric coolers and heat exchangers.
The system might process data and could generate reports or may send alerts.
The interface shall provide clean display with nice graphics and simple navigation.
Data might be stored using MongoDB and transmitted efficiently via REST API with good performance and appropriate security as needed.
The system shall maintain microgravity environment with less than 10^-6 g during operations.
The motor shall provide torque of 50 Nm ±2% at operating temperature range -40°C to 85°C.
The software shall comply with DO-178B Level A certification requirements.
The emergency shutdown system shall be enabled during all powered operations.
The gyroscope shall use MEMS technology and provide accuracy of ±0.1°/hr.
